author: Michiel Van Roey
title: Dapp to control/monetize your data
description: $300B surveillance capitalism market broke the customer relationship. People should control & benefit from the use of their personal data

assessments.note: Considering the importance of data rights protection and management (especially if we take a look at the recent issues caused by misuse of big data) this is a good approach to use blockchain to give the consumer back some of their privacy rights and actually pay them if they still consent to sharing their data. A well-reflected proposal that considers many facets of an important issue.

This project takes an existing centralised application and applies to in a decentralised way on the Cardano blockchain. This would drive a large number of users to interact repeated with the blockchain.

This idea is incredible. Making ordinary people to be in charge of its personal data in an easy way and being compensated for giving permission to use them is incredible.
This is the kind of proposal which brings entrepreneurs from outside the Cardano world which have the will to make the difference in an elegant way in an important project. This proposal has the potential to aggregate value vary fast.

I just think that you could concentrate more power in bringing more brands to the platform in order to bring more people interested in using it.

This is a very ambitious project. If successful it has the potential to bring many non-crypto oriented users to the Cardano ecosystem.  I see good incentives both for businesses using the platform and consumers selling their data. so I think the impact on the challenge goals could be high.
This proposal is creating a different opportunity for monetizing user data, where users are in control of their own data as well as benefiting from it, unlike the current/traditional system.

The scope is stated as (1) "ledger for all data license contract concluded between individuals and businesses." and (2) "ledger for all privacy interactions via the privacy rights management platform". A blockchain with smart contracts is clearly neither needed nor appropriate given these requirements.
assessments.reply: Score of 1/5 whereas average score of 4,07/5 is not constructive, definitely when feedback is based on partial reading. Doesn't address the impact question and is based on an incomplete reading, as this information was given. Under point 3, "Profila tomorrow - catalyst project", subtitle "What do we seek to create in the POCs under this Challenge?", we explained "we will include the relevant elements of a data subject / privacy right (POC 1) or of a data subscription (POC 2) in an immutable (Cardano) blockchain ledger, so each individual has an audit trail of every such transaction (=privacy right exercised) or interaction with a brand (=data subscription contract) that concerned the use of its personal data." We do not put the actual personal data on a public ledger, but only an identifiers of participants and the actual request that was received (e.g. which right; timestamp etc). This provides proof the "EVENT OCCURED".

assessments.note: The team is very experienced and from various different backgrounds. The plan is extremely detailed and basically presents a complete concept that only needs to be implemented on the cardano blockchain, making it extremely likely that the proposal will succeed. The budget is explained. A small grain of salt is that a senior blockchain dev has not yet been acquired, but considering the paygrade that is planned in the budget for this position, this shouldn't be to much of an issue.

The proposers have the domain and technical experience to deliver this project and have detailed how they will do so. As it is expanding their current commercial product that would have a string incentive to deliver the project.

If I understand right the functionality of this app, it first needs to gather the brands to join the platform to, after, do everything they want to do.
In the proposal it is very clear that there are some brands that already see value in this 'new way to approach to customers', and it was very clear that the majority of them, 80%, believe that they're in the right way of doing advertisements and manage the public data.
Therefore, how are you intending to aggregate value to them in order to bring new brands to the platform (since they only see profit)? – I imagine that if you can make an statistic about the improvement of this type of interaction among the brands that are testing the POC and the clients, in the perspective of brands (profitability using this platform, more interested clients, etc), would be a great tool to show them that this new model is better than the old and invasive one.

The project appears to be at an advanced state of development, although I haven't done thorough due diligenct. According to comments a Profila smart phone app is about to be released. Their is an extensive team working on the project according to the website. The proposal is very detailed and broken into manageable stages. It is hard to gauge the project's commitment to Cardano, but if they are as far along as they make out, Cardano can only benefit from integration into the project.  I also not that the team has been very responsive to community questions and has an overall professional demeanor.

Having been working on the product for 3 years, the proposers definitely have what it takes to be successful, with clear guidelines. ur platform allows businesses to take huge steps in becoming privacy compliant. One benefit of recent privacy legislations (like GDPR, CCPA, LGDP) which requires companies to be transparent about the processing of personal data, inform the consumer would benefit commerce to use this system and thus increase its likelihood of success.

All neccessary information is provided in this indeed very detailed and structured proposal, which presents a solid, actionable project that can be assessed positively with confidence. Especially the replies to the feedback from the last funding round show that the process is really taken seriously.

This is a well thought out and described project. It is a strong candidate to receive funding under this proposal. It should be noted the proposers have submitted another proposal for 19200 funding under the metadata challenge
I would like a more detailed roadmap in order to be easier to identify the milestones (intervals smaller than 3 months, e.g.)

The submission for current funding is broken in to two largely independent tasks that develop core aspects of the overall project. funds are broken down into developer costs for each project. Auditing will mostly consist of assessment of any viable products produced before subsequent Catalyst rounds.
Key measurement for the success of this project is clearly stated such as: onboarding 5 SME companies in 3 regions, with expectation of about 1000-2000 people to join per month as from May 2021

solution: Consent-based customer data (D)app, using smart contracts to record personal data licenses; compensating people for their data & attention
experience: Privacy/Tech lawyer with 10Y XP in (project relevant) legal issues - consumer privacy; digital marketing; data rights & virtual currencies.
